main event: A radar blip detected an unidentified object traveling at approximately 1700 knots, or 2-3 times the speed of a fighter aircraft, at an altitude of around 60,000 feet over the Atlantic Ocean on March 15, 1961.
interesting points: The object was detected by military radar, but visual observation was not possible.
The object traveled in a straight line and then disappeared below the horizon.
The object had a magnitude of 1.7 and was tracked for around 8 minutes.
The object's course took it from a bearing of 045 degrees to a bearing of 161 degrees.
The object passed below the stars Rigel and Sirius during the observation period.
